definitions.definition: having drunk so much alcohol that it is impossible to think or speak clearly

examples.text: They were clearly too drunk to drive.
His only way of dealing with his problems was to go out and **get drunk**.
I was beginning to feel very drunk.
The wine had made her drunk.
By now I was pretty drunk on the free beer.
The room was full of drunk people.

definitions.definition: very excited, tired, etc. because of a particular emotion or situation

examples.text: She was almost drunk with all these new impressions.

definitions.definition: behaving in a noisy or violent way in a public place because you are drunk

examples.text: Police arrested him for being drunk and disorderly.
He rolled home roaring drunk at 3 o’clock in the morning.

wordOrigin: Middle English: past participle of drink; compare with drunken.
